name: Moonlight Schooner
description:
A Caribbean sailor's search for a living.

It's May Day 1958. A small group of Black sailors are stranded on the island of St. Kitts after a terrible storm. The sailors indulge in  a responsibility-free night on the town, as the looming unknowns of imperialism threaten their dreams of a better future.

Dora Award-winning playwright Kanika Ambrose (our place, Truth) shares an evocative tale about the systemic and deliberate breaking of Black men by colonial forces during the Windrush Generation, and the casualties left behind.

name: Zamira Lacosta
description:
A Cuban singer-songwriter based in Toronto since 2014. 

Zamira describes her music as Nueva Trova with Pop Rock, RnB, Flamenco and Afro-Cuban sound. 

Before moving to Canada she was an opera singer for over 10 years, during this time she discovered her passion for writing and started her music journey as a solo artist. Her music is influenced by Elena Burke, Mercedes Sosa, Rosario Flores, Gipsy Kings, Lauryn Hill, Jasmine Sullivan, Polo Montanez and Pablo Milanes to mention a few.

name: Sloth Broth
description:
A jazz fusion duo comprised of Gianluca Occhipinti on keys, synth and synth bass, and Jamie Wells on drums, they are best of friends. 

Music has always sat at the core of their camaraderie, a quality they hope remains constant as their friendship unfolds into the unyielding passage of time. So if you like to be dazzled, brazzled and swazzled by the groove, come catch a show and we'll be sure to be your friend too.

name: The National Women's Show

location.name: Metro Toronto Convention Centre, South Building

description:
Join us for a fantastic day filled with fashion, food, and fun. 

With over 500 exhibits offering the best and the largest selection of products and services for women there is something for everyone! It's the ultimate Girl's Day Out!

name: Donné Roberts
description:
Toronto-based singer-songwriter/guitarist, born in Madagascar. 

Donné has earned a matchless reputation for his compositions, strong catchy melodic lines that makes his audience sing along with him during live performances, strong message on the lyrics, also the excitement and the high energy and professionalism of his live shows. 

Donné Roberts is a passionate performer. When he hits the stage, he carries with him an energy that immediately exhilarates the crowd even if they've never heard his music before. 

Donné performs mainly in Malagasy mother tongue from his birthplace of Madagascar, proving that music truly does transcend languages.

name: Ever After Romance Fiction Festival
description:
Enjoy three days of panels, readings, interactive workshops and signings with notable authors spanning the romance genre, from westerns, to romantasy, to holiday romance, and more. 

Come to the Ever After Ball, where authors, readers and romantics gather for a night of candlelight, conviviality, and celebration. Dance cards will be filled, secrets whispered, fortunes told—and debut authors honoured in a dazzling spotlight. 

Further events include High Tea, a delicious afternoon of cakes, sandwiches, tea and stories, Tarot Workshops with Lori Dyan, and the Writers Craft Series featuring Masterclasses, workshops, and publishing industry panels.

name: Toy Story in Concert
description:
Making its Canadian debut, we are excited to present the animated classic on the big screen in its entirety, accompanied by a live orchestra performing composer Randy Newman's vibrant score note-for-note. The perfect way to experience the original ahead of next year's Toy Story 5! 

Featuring the FILMharmonique Orchestra, Canada's premier orchestra dedicated to film concerts. Conductor: Francis Choinière.

Presentation licenced by Disney Concerts.

name: Sky & Bone: Realities Unbound

address.streetAddress: Richmond Street West and Spadina Avenue

description:
Visit Sky & Bone, an exhibition featuring over thirty fine art pieces from the City of Toronto Collection alongside works from contemporary Canadian artists. Encounter personal moments that create ceremonial connections beyond everyday realities. Through an Indigenous lens, Jesse King, Curator at Market Gallery, examines land, spirit, and sky to consider the question: Do we transcend our physical selves, and what energies do we interact with and encounter? 
 
Sky & Bone includes artists Abraham Anghik Ruben, Bob Barnabas, Carl Beam, Robert Houle, Rita Letendre, Vanessa Fletcher, and borrowed works by Casey Koyczan, Julia Asimakopulos, Melissa Johns, Rod Mireau and Zahra Saleki. 


Sky & Bone: Realities Unbound is  presented by TD Bank Group

name: Toronto Botanical Garden Holiday Eco Market
description: Go green this holiday season by visiting our annual, eco-minded, nature-inspired, relaxed holiday market shopping experience.

name: Older and Reckless

location.name: The Fleck at Harbourfront Centre Theatre

address.streetAddress: 231 Queens Quay West Toronto, ON M5J 2G8

description:
Moonhorse Dance Theatre's acclaimed series returns to the stage this fall as it celebrates its 25th anniversary featuring four dance works created and performed by luminary dance artists. 

The works seek to redefine destructive assumptions about age and dance ability, celebrating artists over 45 who continuously take risks, ask pertinent questions and dig deep into nuance.

This year's bill includes "Handmade" a premiere duet by acclaimed Montreal based artists Marc Boivin and Louise Bédard that explores the invitation to be Older & Reckless; "de corazón" a love letter to the heart—its resilience, its mischief, its ache, and its boundless capacity for joy, choreographed by William Yong and performed by ballet legend Sonia Rodriguez; and "Elsinore/night hours" a highly anticipated remount of a work by Carol Anderson and performed by Julia Sasso, originally presented by this dynamic duo in 1999.

name: Gandhaar Amin and Dhaivat Jani
description:
Gandhaar Amin grew up learning Indian classical music on the Bansuri, since the age of 4. After spending the first 20 years of his life deeply immersed in this traditional art form, Gandhaar decided to use this learning to create music that smoothly blends centuries old melodic structures with modern electronic music production. The idea was to bring traditional Indian music to a global audience in a way that can be presented in performance venues and environments available to us today.

Gandhaar has since released multiple EPs and singles, polishing the unique sound that he discovered through this blending of distinctly different worlds. He has been performing this music as a solo performer and with a band for about a decade. Since moving to Toronto a year ago, he teamed up with tabla player and drummer Dhaivat Jani, who fit right in and was the perfect partner to play this music live with.

name: Holiday EcoMarket
description: Go green this holiday season by visiting the annual Toronto Botanical Garden Holiday EcoMarket, an eco-minded, nature-inspired, relaxed shopping experience.

name: That's so Embarrassing
description:
A unique storytelling comedy show in downtown Toronto, featuring some of the city's most talented storytellers and comedians. This month, they will all be telling true stories about their most embarrassing moments. 

Do you delight in hearing about other people's most awkward, embarrassing moments? Do you love stories worth gossiping over? Are you a shameless fan of schadenfreude? Then this is the show for you!

name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Conductor Mei-Ann Chen

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Bold, passionate, and innovative, Taiwanese American Mei-Ann Chen is renowned as one of the most versatile and dynamic conductors on the podium today, praised for the energy and enthusiasm with which she infuses orchestras and performances. 

A passionate advocate for music education, Ms. Chen dedicates significant time in mentoring young conductors through various programs, including the Chicago Sinfonietta Freeman Conducting Fellowship program and the Taki Alsop Fellowship, and conducts ensembles at important educational institutions, both nationally and abroad. 

Highly regarded as a compelling communicator and a creative leader both on and off the podium, and a sought-after guest conductor, she has appeared with distinguished orchestras throughout the Americas, Europe, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, and Scandinavia, and continues to expand her relationships with over 150 orchestras worldwide.

name: Windborne
description:
Captivating show draws on the singers' deep roots in traditions of vocal harmony, while the absolute uniqueness of their artistic approach brings old songs into the present. 

Known for the innovation of their arrangements, their harmonies are bold and anything but predictable.

"The best musical discovery of the year... Stunningly powerful vocal harmony...Windborne sets a new bar for folk harmony singing today.", says Brian O'Donovan of WGBH Boston.

BBC Traveling Folk describes Windborne as "subverting expectations and redefining the genre [of vocal music] ... just absolutely phenomenal!" Audiences and critics lavish praise upon the singers not only for their technical mastery, but for the passion, engagement and connection with each other and the audience that imbues each performance with a rare power.
